Title: The Karate Kid
Original title: The Karate Kid
Genre: Action
Length: 126 min
Country: USA
USA release: 11/06/2010
Released in Spain: 27/08/2010
Released on DVD (rental): 14/12/2010
DVD release (sale): 14/12/2010
Blu-ray release: 14/12/2010
Studio: Columbia Pictures (Sony)
Director: Harald Zwart
Writer: Chris Murphy, Steven Conrad
Starring: Jackie Chan, Jaden Smith, Taraji P. Henson
Rating: Not recommended for children under 7 years


Synopsis:
Dre tells the story of Parker (Jaden Smith) a boy of twelve years that could have been the most popular kid in Detroit but the work of his mother (Taraji P. Henson) will have to move to China. At first Dre has trouble making friends but manages to connect with Mei Ying, a classmate-and each other - until the cultural differences make friendship impossible. And to make matters worse, the enemy misses the class bully, Cheng. Dre only knows some karate and kung fu land, easily Cheng tomb "karate kid" on the ground. Dre is lonely in a foreign country and the only friend you can go is the maintenance man, Mr. Han (Jackie Chan). The secret is that Mr. Han is a master of kung fu and when they begin to train together will be born a friendship that will defy Cheng Dre in a final showdown in a kung fu tournament. Han teaches kung fu Dre that is not going to stick to dodge punches and blows, but rather calm and maturity and Dre will learn to face the thugs will be the fight of his life.

Production notes:
Remake of 'Karate Kid', a film starring Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita in 1984
